title: ExPlates: Spatializing Interactive Analysis to Scaffold Visual Exploration

last_post.content: Next comes ExPlates (IEEE EuroVis 2013), where my student Waqas Javed took the idea to its logical extreme: what if interactions were spatialized as new visual elements? Using a web-based visual canvas, users can interact with a data-flow structure merely by interacting with visualizations, which automatically generates new nodes where the interactions (filtering, transformation, visual changes) have been performed. Youtube: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UNhlhFUcDDo PDF: http://users.umiacs.umd.edu/~elm/projects/explates/explates.pdf 6/

Our work on Hugin (IEEE ITS 2010) drew inspiration from LARK (2009) to create a visual data-flow pipeline on touch-based tabletops. The key contribution here was to enable mixed-presence collaboration for visual analysis on tabletops where some collaborators were co-located and some were distributed. Accordingly, Hugin (the name of one of Odin's ravens) have support for access control on the level of individual visual elements. last_post.content:
À la suite de ma demande au ministère de l'intérieur en août 2021 (https://madada.fr/demande/effectifs_policiers_par_circonsc) et d'un recours devant le tribunal administratif, le ministère a mis en ligne les bilans sociaux de 2011 à 2020 (https://www.police-nationale.interieur.gouv.fr/Actualites/Bilan-social).
Espérons que ça devienne une habitude. J'avais également demandé le détail des effectifs de policiers et gendarmes par circonscription, mais hélas, le ministère dit ne pas disposer d'informations plus précises que la répartition par grandes régions... À suivre.

What we want to be clear about is the difference between probability and odds: e.g. probability 1/2 <=> odds 1:1.
